replies.body:
On the one hand we have Riot claiming that they "aim to preserve alternate builds".
On the other hand we have them destroying every single one of them when they update a champion - even deliberately going out of their way to do so by reducing scaling that has zero effect on a champion's primary build.

Since actions speak louder than words I'm just going to call their words a blatant lie.

And than we see what happens when riot listens to all of this 'keep my offbuild' q.q...
{{champion:90}} *
.
.
.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

They should give a * about offbuilds when redesigning a champion - instead they should add some minor off-scalings here and there to allow people to experiment with the new numbers and maybe discover a new offbuild... but keeping a certain secondary build in mind while reworking can't end well...

--------------------------
*I wont blame Riot for anything that went wrong during Malz MYMU - I soley blame all this Keep-AD-Malz threads which outnumbered Malzs total PLAYERBASE for this fiasco.

Erm, no, you should absolutely blame Riot for that whole thing with Malz. They decided to take him in a minion master route, not the players. The players wanted to maintain some level of interaction between AD Malz and the voidlings, they didn't need it to be an absolute focus of his rework. Malzahar is a Prophet of the Void, last I recall, not the harbinger of the Void, not the summoner of the Void, the prophet. The problem with Malz is definitely Riot's fault for shifting the focus so heavily, and his new passive.

After playing the changes on beta I'm not a big fan, but that one made no sense to me.  Other changes aside what does lowering his ap ratios accomplish?  It's not like ap rammus builds have ever been a problem.  I feel like that's been a trend with updates lately, throwing in nerfs to ap build ratios that hurt the off meta builds without really affecting meta builds.  I really wish riot would at least try to preserve some off meta stuff but they seem to be nerfing them without reason lately.
priority should be making the champions viable and fun to play as and against as intended.

yeah but upping AP ratios doesn't affect tank rammus, same with mf, giving her higher AP ratio doesn't affect AD MF.

and while that should be their focus once they're done balancing tank rammus AP rammus will be forgotten just like how AP mf was forgotten
If people play rammus Ap rather than tank they'd have to rebalance him around that, right now they're focusing on balancing him as a tank and for taht to happen they need people to PLAY him tank
Yeah but it's not like AP Rammus was crowding out tank Rammus in any way, so I see no reason to nerf it now.

I always find these discussions whenever "off" ratios are nerfed. People have to understand that with the rise of issues with "squishies being too tanky" and "tanks dealing too mich damage", things like this have to occur.

If ap-bruiser or even full ap builts on tanks actually were causeing issues that would be a fair point, but even befor the ratio nefs those builts were the exeption and unlike tanky builts on certain assasins/skirmishers, no one ever complained about an ap-mao running rampage or ap rammus destroying teams.
So if those champs were no issue with higher ratios befor, why should they be one now?

Well, he can still do tons of damage without building AP. Like:

{{item:3001}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3047}}

The armor scaling on passive is insane for damage returned! And now ult SLOWS so is more reliable!

Still, I understand your complaint about one less option for the build.

But Wrecking ball Rammus is gonna be stronger than ever, since they actually buffed his tower damage by 15/30/45 (+10% AP) per second on his ult. Full duration that's 120/240/360 (+80% AP) extra damage to towers for a total of 640/1280/1920 (+320% AP).

Granted that's also down to 320/640/960 (+160% AP) vs champs, but the stacking slow means he'll have an easier time applying that damage since it'll be harder to just run out of the AoE.
**I put on my robe and wizard hat**
they've been destroying alternate builds for champions every time they even get mini reworks. it really sucks.
Yeah!  That build we've all tried at least once and do less than .0009% of the time!  It's crucial to his character!

The reason they have to nerf a lot of scalings is to compensate with base dmg or utility in other parts of the kit.

This is especially true for tanks building dmg items. The reverse is done when squishies build tank items.

To make vanguard Maokai better, they had to up his base dmg, and lower his scalings. This would, of course, hurt AP Maokai. The reason they couldn't keep the AP scaling, is that the result would be a tanky champ that could also do a lot of dmg. They try to preserve the build by keeping some scaling, but they want to discourage it, because it promotes a playstyle that could be toxic, when the opportunity is open.

Remember, off-meta builds is what led to lethality ADCs, Cleaver Lucian, and Bruiser Graves Jungle
